newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Acacia on track with Sunrise/Boddington.
newsitem.headline: Acacia on track with Sunrise/Boddington.

text.p: Acacia Resources Ltd's new Sunrise Dam mine, northeast of Kalgoorlie in Western Australia, produced 7,300 ounces of gold to April 22, managing director Michael Folie told the Bell Securities gold producers conference.
The mine began operations eight weeks ahead of schedule on March 29 and produced 692 ounces in the period to March 31.
The plant was now fully commissioned and recoveries were in line with expectations, Folie said.
He also said that there were more than enough reserves at the Boddington prospect, south of Perth in Western Australia, to justify an operation.
This project is 33.33 percent owned by Acacia with other shareholders being Normandy Mining Ltd with 44.44 percent and Newcrest Mining Ltd with 22.22 percent.
The Wandoo prospect at Boddington was headed towards gold production of 300,000 ounces a year on a throughput of 11.2 million tonnes of ore a year, he said.
The project was "cheap for the number of ounces we are getting".
Drilling at the Wandoo gold porphyry system was showing improving grades at greater depth, with a development decision on Wandoo is expected by the end of the year, Folie said.
Acacia is targetting total 1997 production of more than 350,000 ounces of gold.
